compounddef.title: RANDNF Generate Noncentral F-Distribution Random Variable

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Generates a vector of non-central F-distributed random variables with the specified parameters. The general syntax for its use is y = randnf(n,m,c) where n is the number of degrees of freedom in the numerator, and m is the number of degrees of freedom in the denominator. The vector c determines the non-centrality shift of the numerator.

sect1.title: Internals
sect1.para: A non-central F-distributed random variable is the ratio of a non-central chi-square random variable and a central chi-square random variable, i.e., \[ F_{n,m,c} = \frac{\chi_{n,c}^2/n}{\chi_m^2/m}. \]

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Here we use the randf to generate some non-central F-distributed random variables:
